Package renderer

Class Scene

java.lang.Object
renderer.Scene
public class Scene
extends java.lang.Object
The Scene class holds everything that can be viewed through the camera. All the lights and shapes are derivatives from the abstract SceneObject class so the Scene also holds a list of all the SceneObjects currently contained in the Scene.
Author:
Timothy
See Also:
Camera, Light, Shape, SceneObject

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Scene()
    The empty Scene constructor sets the background color of the scene to black and initializes the sceneObjects, geometries and lights lists.

  • Field Details

    • ORIGIN

      public static final Vector3D ORIGIN
      The Vector3D origin represents the center of the Scene. Everything revolves around this point.
      See Also:
      Vector3D

  • Constructor Details

    • Scene

      public Scene()
      The empty Scene constructor sets the background color of the scene to black and initializes the sceneObjects, geometries and lights lists.
      See Also:
      Color, SceneObject, Shape, Light

  • Method Details

    • getBackgroundColor

      public Color getBackgroundColor()
      Returns:
      A Color object that represents the method returns the background color of the Scene.
      See Also:
      Color

    • getGeometries

      public java.util.List<Shape> getGeometries()
      Returns:
      A java List object that contains all the geometries(shapes) currently in the scene.
      See Also:
      Shape

    • getLights

      public java.util.List<Light> getLights()
      Returns:
      A java List object that contains all the lights currently in the scene.
      See Also:
      Light

    • add

      public void add​(SceneObject sceneObject)
      The add method needs a SceneObjecs as a parameter and adds it to the sceneObjects list. Then it checks if it's an instance of a Shape or a Light class and also adds it to the corresponding list.
      Parameters:
      sceneObject - A SceneObject that gets added to the sceneObjects list and corresponding shapes or lights list.

    • remove

      public void remove​(SceneObject sceneObject)
      The remove method needs a SceneObject as a parameter and removes it from the sceneObjects list. Then it checks if it's an instance of a Shape or a Light class and also removes it from the corresponding list.
      Parameters:
      sceneObject - A SceneObject that gets removed from the sceneObjects list and corresponding shapes or lights list
